project.teaser: UPCAST provides a set of universal, trustworthy, transparent and user-friendly data market plugins for the automation of data sharing and processing agreements between businesses, public administrations and citizens. Our plugins will enable actors in the common European data...
project.objective: UPCAST provides a set of universal, trustworthy, transparent and user-friendly data market plugins for the automation of data sharing and processing agreements between businesses, public administrations and citizens. Our plugins will enable actors in the common European data spaces to design and deploy data exchange and trading operations guaranteeing (i) automatic negotiation of agreement terms, (ii) dynamic fair pricing, (ii) improved data-asset discovery, (iii) privacy, commercial and administrative confidentiality requirements, (iv) low environmental footprint, as well as ensuring compliance with (v) relevant legislation and (vi) ethical and responsibility guidelines. UPCAST will support the deployment of Common European data spaces by consolidating mature research in the areas of data management, privacy, monetisation, exchange and automated negotiation, considering efficiency for the environment as well as compliance with EU and national initiatives, AI regulations and ethical procedures. Four real-world pilots across Europe will operationalise a set of working platform plugins for data sharing, monetisation and trading, deployable across a variety of different data marketplaces and platforms, ensuring digital autonomy of data providers, brokers, users and data subjects, and enabling interoperability within European data spaces. UPCAST aims at engaging SMEs, administrations and citizens by providing a transferability framework, best practices and training to endow users in order to deploy the new technologies and maximise impact of the project.
project.title: Universal Platform Components for Safe Fair Interoperable Data Exchange, Monetisation and Trading
project.keywords: Data, data exchange, Monetisation, trading, platform, data sharing, framework, data spaces

article.title: Components for safe, fair, interoperable data

result.title: Negotiation and Execution modules v1
result.description: Early delivery of the initial algorithms and tools for negotiation (T3.1), and secure execution and monitoring of the federated UPCAST plugins (T3.2).

result.title: Pricing and Discovery Modules v1
result.description: Delivery of the first version of the data analyser (T2.3) and the general data discovery tool (T2.4)

result.title: Monitoring and Evaluation Methodology
result.description: hybrid wiki-manual describing expectations for the platform elements, the detailed M&E process, metrics and KPIs common to all pilots and particular to each site. It will provide the basis for technical evaluation (and corrective measures if needed) as well as assessment of functional and user requirements. It will describe each element in the IPR catalogue D7.1 and facilitate sustainability planning.

result.title: Updated project concept and architecture
result.description: Revised version of the architecture and interfaces based on the work done in T1.5, the final vocabulary and data model (T1.3).

result.title: Project concept requirements setup
result.description: Early delivery of the requirements and initial usage scenarios (technical from T1.1, pilots from T1.2, legal T1.4).

result.title: Dissemination and communication plan v2
result.description: Initial and interim reports containing the dissemination and communication plans and undertaken dissemination and communication activities updated on a yearly basis. The results of Dissemination will also be reported in Periodic reporting

result.title: MVP definition and architecture
result.description: Definition of the main features to be delivered in the UPCAST MVP (T1.1), the initial UPCAST architecture and interface to develop the MVP (T1.5), the final pilot design and functionalities (T1.2), as well as the initial input related to the vocabulary and data model (T1.3).

result.title: Environmental Module v1
result.description: Early delivery of the initial algorithms for environmentally efficient data operations (T3.3).

result.title: Dissemination and communication plan v1
result.description: Initial and interim reports containing the dissemination and communication plans and undertaken dissemination and communication activities updated on a yearly basis. The results of Dissemination will also be reported in Periodic reporting.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - UPCAST (Universal Platform Components for Safe Fair Interoperable Data Exchange, Monetisation and Trading)
result.teaser: The UPCAST project, funded by the Horizon Europe program, focuses on developing universal, trustworthy, transparent, and user-friendly plugins for data marketplaces. These plugins aim to improve the quality of data transactions between businesses, public administrations, and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Contractual Clauses Legal Assessment report v1
result.description: The deliverable will provide a legal toolkit to ensure legal validity of data sharing contractual clauses. It will analyse the extent to which usage conditions in data sharing contractual clauses may be subject to negotiation, in compliance with applicable law. This assessment will be the legal input for task 2.1.

result.title: Online project presence
result.description: This deliverable includes the project’s website and social media channels that will be released at M1 and will be regularly updated till the end of the project.

result.title: Privacy and Usage Control Modules v1
result.description: Delivery and reporting on the architecture and detailed documentation regarding T2.1 and T2.2.

result.title: Report on legal framework and requirements
result.description: This report will present an overview of the law applicable to online platforms for data sharing and the legal implications of (fully) automated contracts. Beyond the current applicable law, the analysis will also take into account the latest legislative and policy initiatives regarding digital services and data sharing activities and, provide recommendations. Final version of the legal framework (T1.4), updated from D1.1

result.title: White Paper on the Definition of Data Intermediation Services

details.authors: Bobev, Tervel and Dessers Vilte Kristina and Ducuing Charlotte and Fierens Michiel and Palumbo Andrea and Peeters Bert and Stähler Leander
details.publisher: KU Leuven Centre for IT & IP Law - imec

category.title: data exchange
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/data science/data exchange

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
